data.title: Philip V of Spain
data.text:
Philip V of Spain (19 December 1683 – 9 July 1746) was King of Spain from 1 November 1700 to 14 January 1724, and again from 6 September 1724 to his death in 1746

First marriage[edit]

On 3 November 1701, he married Maria Luisa of Savoy (17 September 1688 – 14 February 1714) daughter of Victor Amadeus II of Sardinia and Anne Marie d'Orléans.

Issue[edit]

Infante Luis of Spain (later King Luis I) (25 August 1707 – 31 August 1724) married Louise Élisabeth d'Orléans but had no issue.

Infante Felipe of Spain (2 July 1709 – 18 July 1709) died in infancy.

Infante Felipe Pedro Gabriel of Spain (7 June 1712 – 29 December 1719) died in infancy.

Infante Fernando of Spain (later King Fernando VI) (23 September 1713 – 10 August 1759) married Infanta Maria Barbara of Portugal but had no issue. .

Second marriage[edit]

On 24 December 1714, he married Elisabetta Farnese, Princess of Parma (25 October 1692 – 11 July 1766) daughter of Odoardo Farnese, Hereditary Prince of Parma and Dorothea Sophie of Neuburg.

Issue[edit]

Infante Carlos of Spain (later King Carlos III) (20 January 1716 – 14 December 1788) Duke of Parma then King of Naples and Sicily then King of Spain. Married Maria Amalia of Saxony and had issue.

Infante Francisco of Spain (21 March 1717 – 21 April 1717) died in infancy.

Infanta Mariana Victoria of Spain (31 March 1718 – 15 January 1781) married the future Joseph I of Portugal and had issue.

Infante Felipe of Spain (later Duke of Parma) (20 March 1720 – 18 Julie 1765) Duke of Parma married Louise Élisabeth of France and had issue.

Infanta Maria Teresa of Spain (11 June 1726 – 22 July 1746) married Louis Ferdinand of France, Dauphin of France and had issue.

Infante Luis of Spain (later Count of Chinchón) (25 Julie 1727 – 7 August 1785) Archbishop of Toledo, Primate of Spain. secretly married María Teresa de Vallabriga and had issue.

Infanta Maria Antonia of Spain (17 November 1729 – 19 September 1785) married Victor Amadeus III of Sardinia and had issue.

Titles[edit]

19 December 1683 - 1 November 1700 The Duke of Anjou, Son of France.

1 November 1700 – 15 January 1724 His Majesty The King.

15 January 1724 - 6 September 1724 His Majesty King Felipe.

6 September 1724 – 9 July 1746 His Majesty The King.
